Title: A Valid SSL Certificate Is Used
DirectLink: A Valid SSL Certificate Is Used

Data:
Applies To

  • ASP.NET 4.0

What to Check For

Verify that a valid SSL certificate is used.

Why

Using a valid SSL certificate helps prevent Man-In-The-Middle attacks, protects data in transit and provides a level of assurance to visitors that your site is trusted.

How To Check

To verify that a valid SSL certificate is used, open the SSL-secured area of the site with a web browser. The web browser should indicate whether the SSL certificate is valid in the URL bar. The web browser will display a warning message if the SSL certificate is not valid.

How To Fix

To use a valid SSL certificate on IIS 7.0 or higher:

  1. Purchase a valid SSL certificate. You may purchase a valid SSL key from Verisign, Thawte, or your web hosting provider. Follow the vendor's instructions for purchasing the SSL certificate. The certificate is usually a .cer file.

  2. Import the valid SSL certificate. Start the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager". Select the server in the left pane. Double-click on the "Server Certificates" icon in the right pane. Click on "Complete Certificate Request..." in the right-most pane. Click the "..." button to navigate to the .cer file that you have purchased. Enter the name of your site as the "Friendly name". Click "OK" to install the certificate.

  3. Create HTTPS bindings. Start the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager". Right-click on each site and select "Edit bindings...". Add a binding of the "https" type. Please, select the SSL certificate you've installed in the "SSL Certificate:" dropdown.
